description: From Middle English misty, mysty, misti, from Old English mistiġ (“misty, dark”); equivalent to mist +‎ -y. Cognate with Scots misty, mistie (“misty”), Dutch mistig (“misty, foggy”), Middle Low German mistich (“foggy”).

examples: It's very misty this morning; I can't see a thing!
a misty memory of his childhood

entries.meaning: (figuratively) With tears in the eyes; dewy-eyed.
examples: Her eyes grew misty the night her long-time friend passed away.
